text: The Serpentine Pavilion of 2015 SelgasCano is a Spanish architectural office based in Madrid and founded in 1998 by José Selgas and Lucía Cano. Their work includes three Auditoriums and congress centers in Spain (Auditorio de Badajozhttps://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palacio_de_Congresos_de_Badajoz, https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auditorio_y_palacio_de_congresos_El_Batel Auditorio El Batel Cartagenahttps://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auditorio_y_palacio_de_congresos_El_Batel and Auditorio de Plasenciahttps://www.archdaily.com/910529/plasencia- auditorium-and-congress-center-selgas-cano), several office buildings such as Second Home Londonhttps://www.archdaily.com/769707/second-home-london-office- selgascano, Second Home Lisboahttps://www.dezeen.com/2017/02/14/second-home- lisboa-market-hall-co-working-plants-office-selgascano-portugal and Second Home Los Angeleshttps://www.archdaily.com/928819/second-home-hollywood-office- selgascano, a school in Kibera Nairobi https://www.dezeen.com/2017/01/05/selgascano-designed-pavilion-transformed- into-school-for-kenyas-kibera-slum, a vaccination center in Turkana Kenya https://www.architecturalrecord.com/articles/7996-konokono-vaccination-center, and several public pavilions including the 15th annual Serpentine Pavilion 2015 in London https://www.serpentinegalleries.org/exhibitions- events/serpentine-pavilion-2015-designed-selgascano, which was re-installed at La Brea Tar Pits in Los Angeles in 2019 https://tarpits.org/experience-tar- pits/second-home-pavilion. Selgascano´s office in the woods in Madrid https://www.archdaily.com/21049/selgas-cano-architecture-office-by-iwan-baan is the most visited project https://www.archdaily.com/484856/the-20-most- visited-archdaily-projects-of-all-time in the specialized architecture website Archdaily. Selgascano's work has been exhibited in MOMA New York https://www.moma.org/artists/29835, Bruges Trienal https://triennalebrugge.be/en/nieuws/the-selgascano-pavilion-is-a-winner, Guggenheim New York, GA gallery in Tokyo, the MOT(Contemporary Art Museum of Tokyo, the Design Museum of London, the Akademie der Kunste in Berlin, the Tin Sheds Gallery in Sydney, the MIT in Boston, the architecture Venice Biennale in Venice and the Louisiana Museum in Copenhagen. ==References== ==Further reading== * * ==External links== *SelgasCano official website Category:Architecture firms of Spain
